column4: Hi - I'm looking to install skype onto my dell mini with 8.04 ubuntu and when I run the package installer i get the following error message: "Error: Wrong architecture 'i386'" - Can anyone help me figure out what I can fix to get skype up and running please? Also, I'm a new user so commands/ advice needs to be given in simple terms!!! Thanks
you are using 64 bit ubuntu isnt it
uname -a in a terminal
I think so, but how do I confirm
uname -a?
there is a 64 bit package of skype available now
yeah
main menu>accessories>terminal
Linux user 2.6.24-19-lpia #1 SMP Tue Jul 29 14:02:05 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
ok u have 32 bit, i think you downloaded the wrong skype
need the 32 bit skype
regular 32 bit skype
there's the 8.10 +32 bit skype, should I try that?
yeah that one
at the moment I am trying the bog std 8.04 version grrrrrr
sadly, still the same error message: "Error: Wrong architecture 'i386'" Grrrrr
ok then try the 64 bit
even though ur system says its 32 bit os
will try grrrrr
)o; Not working "Error: Wrong architecture 'amd64'!
ok ok strange indeed
i think you again tried the 64 bit skype
which version of ubuntu is this
yeh I tried all three versions
try the skype static version
can u paste uname -a again please
I tried the bog standard skype 8.04 and the two 8.10 version, nothing
Linux user 2.6.24-19-lpia #1 SMP Tue Jul 29 14:02:05 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
yeh and I thinkit is the 8.04, anyway i can confirm?
yea in terminal cat /etc/lsb-release
i sent my netbook into dell to repair a month ago, operating system wasn't working as not enough hard drive (i have a little 4g machine) but skype was working before, now it isn't....
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
ok its 8.04 32 bit
when I was on here last week, someone was telling me to "force architecture" or something along those lines, I couldn't run it as it asked for user password which I now know...
ya force architecture is for installing 32 bit software on 64 bit os
I seee
sudo dpkg -i --force-architecture skype............
so whats the status
how do I paste what it said? can't use the enter function?

user@user:~$ sudo dpkg -i --force-architecture skype-ubuntu-intrepid_2.1.0.47-1_amd64.deb [sudo] password for user:  dpkg: error processing skype-ubuntu-intrepid_2.1.0.47-1_amd64.deb (--install):  cannot access archive: No such file or directory Errors were encountered while processing:  skype-ubuntu-intrepid_2.1.0.47-1_amd64.deb user@user:~$
for all long messages , go to paste.ubuntu.com then paste it there, then write your name and press send, then copy url and paste here
ok, noted!
is the file on the desktop?
if yes then in terminal cd Desktop
no double click wotn work
all of course
did you double click on the 32 bit skype file or not
just open a terminal and copy paste    sudo apt-get install ia32-libs
libs is libraries
yeah i think you are trying to install wrong skype
did you install this system? or you have a super nerdy boyfriend or husband or lady friend who did something
none of the above, system came with dell mini 9 - piece of pooo*
ya download 32 bit , place it on desktop, then double click on it
should install like a breeze
please help me solve your problem :)
didn't work!
what error
dont run commands, just double click on file
same error dude, same flippen error: "Error; Wrong architecture 'i368'", I ran AP's command re clearing out skype
did double click hun, nothing!
thanks, toodles
post your uname -a for all to see
difficult but works http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=962835
you have a diff version of ubuntu special for your machine
wait iam searchign\
ok found it, use skype static from the website
ignore previous messages , you need the skype static package from website, then you can install it
ok so I follow those forum instructions with the standard 8.04 version?
in skype site, there is a download called skype static
skype static? not 8.04? ok will look
ok i see it, will download
yes its there , look a little below
then do I double click on that to install?
but before that try the force architecture with the 32 bit skype i hear it works too
http://forum.skype.com/index.php?showtopic=220791
open a terminal
confused hun, ok so I need to download the 32 bit skype and try the commands from above to force it, if that doesn't work then try static version?
u already have 32 bit downloaded on desktop?
open terminal and type  cd Desktop
then type sudo dpkg -i --force-architecture skype-debian_2.0.0.72-1_i386.deb
if this fails with error, just go ahead with the static version, it will work but the installation is different
ok hold up, open terminal. done
ill be back later
cd Desktop
i'm not trying the debian package though, i'm tring the hardy or intrepid ones?
hello?
yah try hardy or intrepid
ok
go if you have to, will ask someone else, sorry!
i have 1 min
did u do cd Desktop?
i assume the 32 bit skype is on desktop
yes 32 bit on desktop, http://paste.ubuntu.com/293963/
